synthesized_claims.statement: Reorganization of OMM cholesterol-rich lipid domains can shift VDAC1 from a honeycomb to a dispersed state.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: VDAC1 localization and oligomerization are modulated by lipid environment; cholesterol depletion disperses VDAC1 clusters, implying mechanical disruption of cholesterol domains would have a similar effect.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Showing that ultrasound-induced VDAC1 dispersion occurs even in cholesterol-depleted OMMs where domains are already disrupted.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Reorganization of OMM cholesterol-rich lipid domains can shift VDAC1 from a honeycomb to a dispersed state.

synthesized_claims.statement: Cancer OMMs (↑cholesterol ~2x, ↓CL ~50%) have lower threshold (~0.5x I) for US-induced VDAC1 transition vs. healthy cells.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Elevated chol rigidifies domains but reduces CL-VDAC affinity, making lattice fragile to lower shear.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Dose-response curves (oligomerization vs. I) identical in cancer/healthy mito liposomes.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Cancer OMMs (↑cholesterol ~2x, ↓CL ~50%) have lower threshold (~0.5x I) for US-induced VDAC1 transition vs. healthy cells.

synthesized_claims.statement: Ultrasound at clinically relevant frequencies and intensities can deliver sufficient mechanical energy to the OMM to transiently disrupt lipid microdomains.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Acoustic radiation force and cavitation-induced shear stress generate pressure and strain fields within the cell that exceed the low energy barriers for lipid lateral diffusion and phase separation.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Super-resolution imaging of fluorescently-labeled cholesterol and cardiolipin in the OMM of isolated mitochondria showing no spatial reorganization during sonication at 3 W/cm².
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Ultrasound at clinically relevant frequencies and intensities can deliver sufficient mechanical energy to the OMM to transiently disrupt lipid microdomains.

synthesized_claims.statement: No direct evidence links clinical US to VDAC1 oligomerization via lipids.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Literature shows US membrane effects (sonoporation) but not OMM-specific VDAC1 state change.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Peer-reviewed study demonstrating US-VDAC1 oligomerization in intact cells. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: No direct evidence links clinical US to VDAC1 oligomerization via lipids.

synthesized_claims.statement: 1:** Ultrasound at 1–3 MHz (0.1–3 W/cm²) can propagate mechanical energy to the OMM with sufficient intensity to disrupt cholesterol/cardiolipin domains, but 20–100 kHz therapeutic US is unlikely to do so at these intensities.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: MHz US generates cavitation and microstreaming near membranes, while kHz US requires higher intensities for comparable mechanical effects due to longer wavelengths and lower energy deposition at the OMM.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: *In vitro* measurements of OMM lipid domain reorganization (e.g., Laurdan GP imaging) under US exposure showing no change at 20–100 kHz but detectable shifts at 1–3 MHz. ---
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 1:** Ultrasound at 1–3 MHz (0.1–3 W/cm²) can propagate mechanical energy to the OMM with sufficient intensity to disrupt cholesterol/cardiolipin domains, but 20–100 kHz therapeutic US is unlikely to do so at these intensities.

synthesized_claims.statement: 4:** The mechanical energy required to reorganize OMM lipids exceeds the thermal noise floor but is within the range of clinically relevant US intensities (1–3 MHz, 0.5–3 W/cm²).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Lipid domain reorganization requires ~10⁻²⁰–10⁻¹⁹ J per molecule (estimated from membrane bending rigidity), achievable via MHz US microstreaming at 1–3 W/cm².
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Molecular dynamics simulations or atomic force microscopy showing no lipid domain disruption at these US parameters. --- ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 4:** The mechanical energy required to reorganize OMM lipids exceeds the thermal noise floor but is within the range of clinically relevant US intensities (1–3 MHz, 0.5–3 W/cm²).
